sentences.en: " Yes, you came swiftly, dragging me at your chariot wheels.
sentences.cn: " 是的, 你走得很快, 把我拴在你的车轮上拖着走.

sentences.en: I drove my chariot to the vineyard gate, and there I saw the twoKings.
sentences.cn: 我驾着战车来到葡萄园的门口，看到了那两个国王。

sentences.en: It will not come in the night on some grand chariot.
sentences.cn: ?不会在夜里乘着某辆高贵的马车而来.

sentences.en: Moses was given a splendid chariot and treated a prince.
sentences.cn: 摩西被赐予了一辆豪华的战车,并像王子一样被对待.

sentences.en: Rehoboam himself managed to mount his chariot and flee to Jerusalem.
sentences.cn: 勒哈贝罕王急忙上车,逃回了耶路撒冷.

sentences.en: So he had his chariot made ready and took army with him.
sentences.cn: 这样,所有的埃及军兵和战车就都覆没在大海之中;法老派来的大军,全军覆没.

sentences.en: Speaker A And he is gluing together the chariot's rail.
sentences.cn: 演说者A:他还粘起了战车的围栏.

sentences.en: Swing low, sweet chariot, Comin'for to carry me home.
sentences.cn: 摆动低, 甜战车 comin ',为开展我回家.

sentences.en: The chariot ride may become more balanced, but no less bumpy.
sentences.cn: 中印马车可能会变得更加平衡, 但道路不会更加平坦.

sentences.en: The Romans liked watching chariot racing.
sentences.cn: 罗马人喜欢观看战车赛.

sentences.en: Then the SpirIt'said to Philip, " Go up and join this chariot. "
sentences.cn: 徒 8:29 圣灵对腓利说 、 你去贴近那车走.

sentences.en: Then, when much blood had clogged their chariot-wheels, I would go up and wash them from sweet wells, Even with truths that lie too deep for taint.
sentences.cn: 因此当大量的血液凝固，阻塞了战车前进的轮之际，我就要起身，用甘甜清澈的井水刷洗猩红，甚至是用深深隐藏在污点后的事实。

sentences.en: They had now acquired the war - horse and the war - chariot, which the Hyksos had brought to them.
sentences.cn: 他们现在得到了战马和战车, 那是希克索斯带给他们的.

sentences.en: Thor traveled in a chariot drawn by male goats.
sentences.cn: 到处游走均有飞马车陪伴.

sentences.en: Was returning, and sitting in chariot read Esaias the prophet.
sentences.cn: 现在回来, 在车上坐着,念先知以赛亚的书.

sentences.en: Was returning, and sitting in his chariot read Esaias the prophet.
sentences.cn: 28现在回来, 在车上坐着,念先知以赛亚的书.

sentences.en: Well, I will dismiss my chariot, and go with you.
sentences.cn: 好吧, 我把车子打发回去,跟你一起走.

sentences.en: When humans first started building things, determining whether they would work as planned was mostly a matter of trial and error. Build a bridge, drive a chariot across it, and see if it collapsed.
sentences.cn: 一开始人类建造房屋时,决定房屋是否合格的方法是去试一下,看看有什么不妥的地方.建成一座桥,把辆战车开上面跑一跑,看看桥会不会倒.

trans.tran_cn: 敞篷双轮马车（古代用于战争或竞赛），战车
trans.tran_en: a vehicle with two wheels pulled by a horse, used in ancient times in battles and races

trans.tran_cn: 驾驭（过去式charioted，过去分词charioted，现在分词charioting，第三人称单数chariots）
